Best Marvel movie since Infinity War. This movie actually had a soul. It wasn't made just for the sake of releasing a movie, or making money. The script, the casting, the art direction, the cinematography, was DRIPPING with passion and love. If you're watching the trailer trying to decide if you want to see the movie, and you see this comment... I want you to know that this isn't just a comic book movie, it's a film. It's exactly what I want out of a comic book movie. It was made with love and care, it cares about the source material, and it isn't afraid to be what it is. A Fantastic Four film. It's like you've dunked your head INTO a comic book.
What I really like about this trailer is that it starts off so light and innocent..until 0:45 when the bottom falls out. And the way they change the entire tone of the trailer with that one note.👍👍👍

Thank God they didn’t mess it up like they did with Superman but that's what you expect from DC movies. The Fantastic Four finally feels like it's in the right hands. What really sets it apart is that beautiful vintage touch — it gives the film a unique identity that stands out from the typical MCU formula. It feels like a respectful nod to the classic comics while still offering something fresh. If Marvel keeps this tone consistent, this might actually be the Fantastic Four film we've been waiting for.

Saw it tonight. It was pretty good. It's a shame it came out after the oh so many boss babe super hero slop fests of late. A little slow in the beginning but all in all I was entertained and didn't feel like I was being skull f*cked by "the message" during the entire movie. Sue storm was a really great character. Her and Reed Richards complemented one another very well. She was motherly, nurturing, and protective. She reaches the height of her abilities when in the act of protecting her child. It was refreshing for a movie to contain a societally helpful message for the 1st time, in such a long time.
